result.execSummary:
The defendant Keilah N. MELLON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
To Fox Community Credit Union; Attention:  Bonnie Timm, at 1515 17th Street, Two Rivers, WI.
Joint and several with Nicole Kahlenberg.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with Nichole Kahlenberg, Luke Yanda, Sam Gomez and Kayla Curtis.

Count 2 - PTC Fraud Against Financial Institution - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1 and 3.   Motion granted.   Sentencing hearing is set for 11-24-15 at 8:30 a.m.   
Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.

Jury trial is set for 08-28-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 1 position.

The parties need more time to finalize the details for all open cases.
Plea date is reset to 07-28-15 at 10:00 a.m.
Minutes.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.

Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant is in custody in the Calumet County Jail.   
Initial appearance is reset to 06-15-15 at 2:30 p.m.

Ann Larson, public defender.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 06-01-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she have no contact with Riverwood Maritime Credit Union, Jeanine Lamantia and Nicole Kahlenberg and that she report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.
